statements: SELECT * FROM user_energy_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT energy_consumed FROM user_energy_data WHERE user_id = 5;
SELECT * FROM user_energy_data WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT id, energy_consumed FROM user_energy_data WHERE user_id = 3 AND timestamp > '2022-02-15';
SELECT SUM(energy_consumed) AS total_energy_consumed FROM user_energy_data;
SELECT user_id, COUNT(id) AS energy_records FROM user_energy_data GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT * FROM user_energy_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT provider_name, location FROM energy_providers WHERE provider_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM energy_providers WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT provider_id, provider_name FROM energy_providers WHERE provider_name LIKE 'P%';
SELECT * FROM user_energy_data JOIN energy_providers ON user_energy_data.user_id = energy_providers.provider_id;
SELECT * FROM user_energy_data LEFT JOIN energy_providers ON user_energy_data.user_id = energy_providers.provider_id;
SELECT user_id, provider_name FROM user_energy_data INNER JOIN energy_providers ON user_id = provider_id;
SELECT user_id, provider_name FROM user_energy_data RIGHT JOIN energy_providers ON user_id = provider_id;
SELECT * FROM user_energy_data CROSS JOIN energy_providers;
SELECT DISTINCT user_id FROM user_energy_data;
SELECT user_id, MAX(timestamp) AS latest_timestamp FROM user_energy_data GROUP BY user_id;
SELECT AVG(energy_consumed) AS avg_energy_consumed, MIN(energy_consumed) AS min_energy_consumed, MAX(energy_consumed) AS max_energy_consumed FROM user_energy_data;
SELECT user_id, CASE WHEN energy_consumed > 50 THEN 'High Consumption' ELSE 'Low Consumption' END AS consumption_level FROM user_energy_data;
SELECT * FROM user_energy_data WHERE timestamp = (SELECT MAX(timestamp) FROM user_energy_data);
SELECT * FROM energy_producers;
SELECT id, name FROM energy_producers;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumers;
SELECT id, name FROM energy_consumers;
SELECT * FROM energy_production;
SELECT producer_id, production_date FROM energy_production;
SELECT producer_id, SUM(production_amount) AS total_production FROM energy_production GROUP BY producer_id;
SELECT producer_id, AVG(production_amount) AS avg_production FROM energy_production GROUP BY producer_id;
SELECT * FROM energy_producers WHERE location='New York';
SELECT * FROM energy_consumers WHERE location='California';
SELECT * FROM energy_production WHERE production_date='2022-12-31';
SELECT * FROM energy_production WHERE production_amount > 1000;
SELECT * FROM energy_production WHERE producer_id=1;
SELECT name, production_amount FROM energy_production JOIN energy_producers ON energy_production.producer_id = energy_producers.id;
SELECT name, production_amount FROM energy_production JOIN energy_producers ON energy_production.producer_id = energy_producers.id WHERE production_amount > 500;

SELECT energy_producers.name AS producer_name, energy_consumers.name AS consumer_name, production_amount FROM energy_production JOIN energy_producers ON energy_production.producer_id = energy_producers.id JOIN energy_consumers ON energy_production.consumer_id = energy_consumers.id;
SELECT production_date, SUM(production_amount) AS total_production FROM energy_production WHERE producer_id=1 GROUP BY production_date;
SELECT producer_id, MONTH(production_date) AS month, SUM(production_amount) AS total_production FROM energy_production GROUP BY producer_id, month;
SELECT producer_id, YEAR(production_date) AS year, SUM(production_amount) AS total_production FROM energy_production GROUP BY producer_id, year;
SELECT * FROM customers
SELECT customer_name, city, country FROM customers
SELECT * FROM supplies
SELECT supply_name, unit_price FROM supplies
SELECT * FROM products
SELECT product_name, category, price FROM products
SELECT * FROM orders
SELECT order_date, customer_id, product_id, quantity FROM orders
SELECT c.customer_name, p.product_name, o.quantity FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.product_id
SELECT s.supply_name, p.product_name, o.quantity FROM supplies s JOIN products p ON s.supply_id = p.supply_id JOIN orders o ON p.product_id = o.product_id LIMIT 5

SELECT c.customer_name, p.product_name, o.quantity, o.order_date FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.product_id ORDER BY o.order_date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT c.customer_name, SUM(o.quantity) AS total_orders FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id GROUP BY c.customer_name ORDER BY total_orders DESC
SELECT s.supply_name, AVG(p.price) AS avg_price FROM supplies s JOIN products p ON s.supply_id = p.supply_id GROUP BY s.supply_name ORDER BY avg_price DESC

SELECT customer_name, city, country, COUNT(*) AS total_orders FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id GROUP BY customer_name, city, country ORDER BY total_orders DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) AS total_orders FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 3 ORDER BY total_orders DESC
SELECT customer_name, order_date, quantity FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id WHERE order_date >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY order_date DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT company_id from EnergyCompany;
SELECT company_name, industry FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE company_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE industry = 'Renewable Energy';
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE company_name LIKE '%Solar%';
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE company_name = 'Green Energy Inc.';
SELECT company_id, company_name FROM EnergyCompany WHERE industry = 'Oil and Gas';
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany ORDER BY company_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany ORDER BY company_id DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT MAX(company_id) FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT AVG(company_id) FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT SUM(company_id) FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT DISTINCT industry FROM EnergyCompany;
SELECT industry, COUNT(*) FROM EnergyCompany GROUP BY industry;
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE company_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE industry NOT IN ('Oil and Gas', 'Coal');
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE industry = 'Renewable Energy' AND company_name LIKE '%Solar%';
SELECT * FROM EnergyCompany WHERE industry = 'Renewable Energy' OR industry = 'Solar Power';
